div1.p: Carter writes a recommendation for Hollings.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to [s.n.] Johnson, December 15, 1919
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
BALTIMORE, MD. Decem 15/19
Dear Dr Johnson:
div1.p:
Dr Hollingsworth asks me to write a
letter to you telling about himself.

He served here as an Interne for one year
endec the service ending about the first
of last July. During this time he was
thrown a good deal on his own respon-
sibility - more than is usually the lot
of Internes. I think this was to an extent
an advantage as he developed considerable
initiative & self-confidencereliance.

I count him a good man professionally
a pretty good surgeon & pretty good
physician, & well read in his profession.
